Class Castle

java.lang.Object
  Castle

public class Castle
extends java.lang.Object

COPYRIGHT (C) 2005 Rob Bauer. All Rights Reserved.

An object to represent a game castle and the rooms it contains. This object will behave (hopefully) as a graph. The rooms will be nodes of the graph. The paths from room to room will be the edges between the nodes.

Version:
1.0 2005-NOV-08
Author:
Rob Bauer

Field Detail

rooms

private Room[] rooms
Contain a list of rooms.

arcs

private java.util.ArrayList<Arc> arcs
Contain a list of the arcs that connect the rooms. Using an ArrayList because rooms will have a many-to-many relationship and the ArrayList will be able to grow to meet the demand.

MAXNUMROOMS

private static final int MAXNUMROOMS
Max number of rooms we'll need to keep track of.

roomDestination - int specifies the index location of the destination room
arcLabel - String containing the arc label (which turns out to be the direction of the arc)

shortestPath

public java.util.ArrayList<DSPRoomSet> shortestPath(Room currentroom,
                                                    Room destinationroom)
Using Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm, find the shortest path between the current room the user is in back to the entrance hall. Dijkstra's algorithm was built using class notes and referencing http://www.math.grin.edu/~rebelsky/Courses/CS152/98S/Outlines/outline.50.html. The algorithm built doesn't match the one's presented the class notes or the link. The algorithm built uses an adjacency matrix to locate the neighbors and to update their distance from the starting node/room. Before finding its neighbors, the shortest distance node/room is found and placed in the found list and removed from the search list. With the new node, find its neighbors, update their weight/cost and return the updated hash map. Keep repeating until the search hash map is empty or we've found the destination room.

Parameters:
currentroom - Room the user is currently in (this is the starting point)
destinationroom - Room the user is wishing to go to in the shortest distance

findNeighbors

private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,DSPRoomSet> findNeighbors(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,DSPRoomSet> search,
                                                                  DSPRoomSet root)
Locate a nodes neighbors. Loop through the number of rooms. Check the adjacency list for a 1. If there's a one then the index value a represents an adjacent room. Calculate the room's distance/weight. Once updated, update the search hash map with the new information.

Parameters:
search - hash map containing all the current rooms/nodes
root - The current room we're traversing
Returns:
Map containing an updated search hash map

findSmallest

private DSPRoomSet findSmallest(java.util.Map search)
Find the smallest cost/weight for a distance from a collection of rooms/nodes.

Parameters:
search - Map containing a list of nodes/rooms to test
Returns:
DSPRoomSet object containing a reference of the matching room and its cost/weight information

clearEntranceHallDoors

public void clearEntranceHallDoors()
Clear the entrance hall of any doors.

addRoomItem

public void addRoomItem(int roomid,
                        java.lang.String itemname)
Add an item to a room. The item MUST be in the enumerated RoomItem list. If not, the item will not be added.

Parameters:
roomid - Room ID to add the item to
itemname - Item name
